caption1:
97th Academy Awards | Winners by Film Probe 

Anora won 5 Oscars | Best Picture, Best Lead Actress, Best Director, Best Original Screenplay, Best Editing 

The Brutalist won 3 Oscars | Best Leading Actor, Best Cinematography, Best Original Score 

Conclave won 1 Oscar | Best Adapted Screenplay 

The Substance won 1 Oscar | Best Make up and Hairstyling 

I‚Äôm Still Here won 1 Oscar | Best International Feature 

Wicked won 2 Oscars | Best Costume Design, Best Production Design 

A Real Pain won 1 Oscar | Best Supporting Actor 

Dune Part 2 won 2 Oscars | Best Sound, Best Visual Effects 

Emilia Perez won 2 Oscars | Best Supporting Actress, Best Original Song 

Flow won 1 Oscar | Best Animated Feature 

Congratulations to all the nominees and winners of this years #Oscars #Academy #AcademyAwards #Winners
caption2:
Conclave (2024) | Film Probe Review 

Take a step inside one of the most secretive ceremonies in the world. Conclave is a political thriller following one of the world most secretive and anxiety events - choosing the new Pope. 

This film was a pleasant surprise for me, since it won a handful of BAFTAs and is nominated for a number of Academy Awards I knew I had to finally sit down and watch it. I am so pleased I did, what a magnificent mystery thriller, a completely unexpected entertaining feature. 

Have you seen @conclavethefilm yet? Thank you so much for reading, if you enjoyed this review please be sure to follow along for more film & tv content! Also, join Probe HQ for exclusives and insights! #conclave #academyawards #ralphfiennes
caption3:
Our Thoughts on the Oscars‚Ä¶ | A Community Post 

Here is a small group of brilliant film accounts here on Instagram, we have all shared our opinions on The Academy Awards. Some are more brief than others but all of our opinions are important and I am pleased to be sharing them! 

Cinema is important to a lot of people in this world, it‚Äôs a chance to escape from reality and a chance to show your artistic flair. Cinema is stories, cinema is performance and cinema is influential. 

The Academy Awards will mean nothing to a lot of people but to me, since I was a kid, it‚Äôs represented the best of the best. I wanted to share this post because I feel like the industry is changing and the academy can‚Äôt keep up. 

Thank you so much for reading all of our opinions, please be sure to check out each account and their incredible content. Also, join Probe HQ for exclusive content and conversations.

#theacademyawards #theoscars #oscars2025 #opinions
caption4:
Director Cameos | by Film Probe 

Have you ever been watching a movie gone, wait a minute?! That was the director! Well, I‚Äôve complied a small list of some directors who are known for making appearances in their films! 

Whether they‚Äôre the star of the show or a minor, blink and you‚Äôll miss it moment I wanted to share a few filmmakers who have made a handful of appearances in their own features. 

Thanks so much for reading, if you enjoyed this post please be sure to follow along for more film & tv content! Also, join a probe HQ for exclusives and extra content! Please comment your favourite director cameos below! 

#director #filmmaker #cameos
caption5:
A Look At The Academy Awards | Through the Years 

The 97th Academy Awards takes place Monday 2nd of March. 

Here is a short reel to take a look back at the annual award ceremony, this reel includes clips from the 1950‚Äôs, 1980‚Äôs, 1990‚Äôs and 2024. 

Who‚Äôs your favourite for this years awards? Do you watch the event or do you not care at all haha! Thanks for watching - hope you enjoyed this look back at the Oscars! 

#academyawards #oscars #lookback #throughtheyears

caption4:
The feeling of being in between. 

‚ÄúI feel like in some ways, you can only feel absence if you really appreciate presence and vice versa. And if you don‚Äôt really appreciate presence, then absence is not gonna hit you as hard.. I think it makes you attend to spaces and time itself.‚Äù - Kogonada (Slant Magazine, 2017)

Columbus (2017), Syndromes and a Century (2006), The Power of Kangwon Province (1998), Taipei Suic*de Story (2020), Made in Hong Kong (1997) and The Mourning Forest (2007). 

#asiancinema
caption5:
‚ÄúAgain and again.. as if under a spell, or hypnotized.. she couldn‚Äôt escape.‚Äù

To film today‚Äôs youth with its sudden outbursts of feelings before it calms back down, with the rapid evolution of affects and the repetitive nature of tension and release, it seemed to me that I had to work as if with a magnifying glass, to maximize everything. I had to be closer to them to try to tease out the details of their emotions, to seize the expressions of their faces. - Hou Hsiao-Hsien (Metrograph, 2001)

Millennium Mambo (2001), Hou Hsiao-Hsien

#asiancinema #taiwanesecinema
deepseek-r1: "Your feed feels like a cinematic meditation on the spaces between‚Äîwhether unpacking the haunting beauty of absence in Kogonada‚Äôs work or magnifying youth‚Äôs fleeting intensity √† la Hou Hsiao-Hsien. The way you bridge Vietnamese immigrant grit with Taiwanese coming-of-age textures is exactly why Stir‚Äôs indie creators would thrive under your lens."
deepseek-r1-new: Your captions don‚Äôt just analyze scenes‚Äîthey unravel the quiet tension between presence and absence, like Kogonada‚Äôs lingering frames or Hou Hsiao-Hsien‚Äôs magnified emotions. That rare gift for turning films into visceral conversations? It‚Äôs exactly why Stir‚Äôs indie creators (think raw, diaspora-driven stories like *D√¨di*) would thrive with your lens.

caption2:
UNYOLO TOP 100 MOVIES
# 15 ‚Äì Prisoners (2013)

Denis Villeneuve doesn‚Äôt just direct films‚Äîhe builds worlds you get lost in. With Prisoners, he takes the crime thriller and injects it with raw emotion, unbearable tension, and a moral dilemma that lingers long after the credits roll.

Some movies grip you from the first scene and never let go. "Prisoners" is one of those films, at its core, Prisoners is about fear, desperation, and how far someone will go to protect the people they love. Hugh Jackman delivers what might be his best performance as Keller Dover, a father pushed to the absolute edge when his daughter goes missing. He‚Äôs not some action hero‚Äîhe‚Äôs just a man breaking apart, driven by pure, raw emotion. On the other side, Jake Gyllenhaal plays Detective Loki, a relentless investigator whose cool, calculating nature is the perfect counter to Keller‚Äôs explosive rage. Their clash‚Äîone emotional, one methodical‚Äîfuels the movie‚Äôs intensity.

Technically, Prisoners is a masterpiece. Roger Deakins‚Äô cinematography turns grey skies and empty streets into a visual representation of grief and fear. J√≥hann J√≥hannsson‚Äôs eerie score creeps into your bones, making the quiet moments even more unsettling. Villeneuve‚Äôs direction is surgical‚Äîevery scene, every shot, every silence is purposeful, pulling you deeper into this nightmare.

But what makes Prisoners unforgettable isn‚Äôt just the mystery of who did it‚Äîit‚Äôs what it asks you along the way. How far would you go to find someone you love? Where‚Äôs the line between justice and vengeance? And once you cross it, can you ever go back?

Would it make your list?

#Top100 #Prisoners #DenisVilleneuve #HughJackman #JakeGyllenhaal #RogerDeakins #CrimeThriller #Suspense #DarkCinema #MustWatch #PsychologicalThriller
caption3:
Oscars 2025: What Are the Odds? üé¨üèÜ

The musical thriller "Emilia P√©rez" has made history with a staggering 13 Oscar nominations, leading this year‚Äôs awards season. This achievement makes it the most-nominated non-English-language film in Oscar history, surpassing previous records held by Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon and Roma.

But the buzz isn‚Äôt all good‚Äîsome say its dominance could actually hurt its chances. Could a backlash cost it the gold?

The odds on Gold Derby are shifting fast, and the controversy surrounding Emilia P√©rez is only making things more unpredictable.

Meanwhile, competition is fierce in categories like Best Picture and Best Actress, with Anora and Demi Moore ("The Substance") emerging as potential frontrunners.

In the Best Actor race, Adrien Brody ("The Brutalist") has earned critical acclaim for his compelling performance, but Timoth√©e Chalamet ("A Complete Unknown")‚Äîportraying Bob Dylan‚Äîcould be a dark horse as he seeks his first Oscar win.

What‚Äôs surprising? How low Dune: Part Two ranks in the odds. Despite its massive success, it‚Äôs struggling to gain traction in major categories.

With the ceremony just days away, anticipation is at an all-time high. Who will take home the gold? Stay tuned!

#Oscars2025 #AcademyAwards #EmiliaP√©rez #BestPicture #BestActress #FilmIndustry #AwardSeason #OscarsPredictions #DemiMoore #TimotheeChalamet #AdrienBrody #TheBrutalist #Wicked #GoldDerby
caption4:
The Monkey (2025)‚†Ä
By Big J (Jo√£o)‚†Ä
‚†Ä
As cinephiles, we love fantasizing about dream teams for movies, and when it comes to horror, it doesn‚Äôt get much better than this: a Stephen King story, produced by James Wan, and written/directed by Osgood Perkins? That‚Äôs an all-star lineup.‚†Ä
‚†Ä
I went in blind, knowing only the talent behind it‚Äîand that was enough for me. The horror? No surprise there. With this crew, that department was in safe hands. What did catch me off guard, though, were the ridiculously over-the-top deaths and the dark humor, which ended up being my favorite part.‚†Ä
‚†Ä
I wouldn‚Äôt call myself a huge Theo James fan, but in this movie? Yeah, I am. Playing two bizarre roles, he nails the weirdness and somehow makes us feel a whole range of emotions‚Äîimpressive, considering how absurd things get.‚†Ä
‚†Ä
Now, here‚Äôs where things get messy. The writing. Ironically, what makes this movie both great and frustrating is just that. Some parts are brilliant‚Äîsome of the best horror writing I‚Äôve seen in a while. And then‚Ä¶ there are moments that feel like they were scribbled by a five-year-old. The contrast is jarring, and it kills the flow at times.‚†Ä
‚†Ä
That said, The Monkey is extremely funny. Honestly, it works better as a comedy than a horror movie. At times, it felt like a wilder, more self-aware Final Destination‚Äîand I hope the upcoming sequel to Final Destination takes some notes from it.‚†Ä
‚†Ä
This is a movie that knows exactly what it is: silly, chaotic, and best enjoyed in a packed theater with a crowd ready to have fun.‚†Ä
‚†Ä
What‚Äôs your favorite dark comedy?‚†Ä
‚†Ä
#Movies2025 #FilmReview #TheMonkey #Horror #DarkComedy #StephenKing #JamesWan #OsgoodPerkins #TheoJames
caption5:
UNYOLO TOP 100 MOVIES‚†Ä
#16 ‚Äì "The Wolf of Wall Street" (2013)‚†Ä
‚†Ä
Few films capture the raw excess of modern capitalism quite like "The Wolf of Wall Street". Directed by Martin Scorsese, this audacious, adrenaline-fueled biopic is a masterclass in dynamic storytelling, technical brilliance, and unrelenting social satire.‚†Ä
‚†Ä
At the heart of the film is Leonardo DiCaprio‚Äôs powerhouse portrayal of Jordan Belfort‚Äîa man whose magnetic charm and insatiable greed pull you deep into the intoxicating world of Wall Street excess. DiCaprio‚Äôs performance is both mesmerizing and repulsive, commanding the screen with a force that‚Äôs hard to look away from. Complementing him are standout performances from Jonah Hill, Margot Robbie, and a stellar ensemble, each contributing to an atmosphere that is simultaneously exhilarating and disquieting.‚†Ä
‚†Ä
Scorsese‚Äôs direction is unmistakable. Thelma Schoonmaker‚Äôs incisive editing slices through frenetic party scenes, rapid-fire dialogue, and moments of stark introspection, creating a rhythmic tapestry that mirrors the chaos of unbridled ambition. Rodrigo Prieto‚Äôs cinematography captures every shimmering detail‚Äîfrom the gleam of skyscrapers to the riotous neon-lit revelries‚Äîpainting a visual portrait of decadence that is both lavish and brutal.‚†Ä
‚†Ä
What makes "The Wolf of Wall Street" truly iconic is its fearless dive into the seductive allure of power and excess. The film‚Äôs innovative use of direct-to-camera addresses and playful visual gags breaks the fourth wall, engaging the audience in a candid conversation about moral bankruptcy and the price of success in a capitalist playground. Its technical prowess is matched by a narrative that refuses to flinch, laying bare the corrupt underbelly of the financial world with unyielding clarity.‚†Ä
‚†Ä
Blending Scorsese‚Äôs trademark style with cutting-edge filmmaking techniques and unforgettable performances, "The Wolf of Wall Street" transcends the traditional biopic to become a visceral exploration of modern excess.‚†Ä
‚†Ä
Would it make your list?‚†Ä
‚†Ä
#Top100 #TheWolfOfWallStreet #MartinScorsese #LeonardoDiCaprio #JonahHill #MargotRobbie #ThelmaSchoonmaker #RodrigoPrieto #CapitalismExposed #ModernExcess
